US State Department spokesperson Simon Cowell Crowley, speaking to reporters in Washington yesterday, too indicated that Cameron Munter had called on Asif Ali Zardari to release the arrested official. We continue to make clear to the government of Pakistan that our diplomat has diplomatic immunity; in our view,( he) was acting in self-defence and should be released... Ambassador Cameron Munter met... with President Asif Ali Zardari to continue to make that point, he said. The increased US pressure came against the backdrop of reports that the Obama administration had suspended all high-level contacts with the Pakistan government over the detention of the US official. , Google co-founder Larry Page will replace Eric Schmidt and take over as Chief Executive Officer in April. Eric Schmidt , 55, who became CEO in 2001, will assume the role of Executive Chairman, focusing externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership, according to the official Google blog spot. Eric Schmidt would continue to act as an advisor to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin .`` Page will take charge of Google s day-to-day operations as Chief Executive Officer starting April 4. Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects, in particular working on new products,'' Eric Schmidt said in the blog spot. The management reshuffle has been

in exchange for Simon Cowell continuing with American Idol, Pop Idol would be pulled off the air, conceding the United Kingdom entirely to The X Factor. London's Independent newspaper quoted one senior music executive as saying, It has come out 75/25 in favor of Simon Cowell . He is the star. He had all the aces. But there was a catch, and a very big one indeed. In exchange for winning the airwaves in the United Kingdom, Simon Cowell forfeited his dream of bringing The X Factor to the United States.
